Posts.Content: Diagnosed with BC Dec 09, had port put in went through chemo with no probelms from port, had bilateral mastectony, lymph nodes removed and radiation. all done with treatment and I just noticed a lump over the port which is hard and is painful at times, have been getting port flushed every 5 wks. I am going to see surgeon tomorrow . Has anyone had this happen to them? Thanks for any info
Posts.Title: Lump over chemo port??

Posts.Content: I am so sorry you have a probelm of hair growing back I have known a few woman that this happened too from breast cancer support group I go to. Mine grew back very thick & curly  which I do love so easy to wash & go. I also had thick hair but it was straight I also heard that alot get their natural hair back after awhile. it has been1 yr. and still all curly. I am also on Arimidex and not finding that it is thinning at all but I did read that this can happen.
Posts.Title: 2 years after chemo, my hair has not grown back

Posts.Content: I should be getting my port removed in June it will be 2 yrs. since my last chemo. Did they remove yours in the office or did you have to go in as a surgery? Hopefully your pain goes away....
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: that is the medication that my oncologists mentioned to me if I have to get off Arimidex. wow only 1 week and have to ge off already ..yes I do not want to lose my hair again...
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: June I will be on Arimidex for 2 yrs. after stage 3B Invasive lobular , bilateral mastectomy, lymph nodes cancer & removed, chemo & radiation. I am dealing with the joint pain but now my cholesterol is 285 and liver enzymes are elevated way too high. Had cat scan today to rule out things and was told from oncologist that it may be the Arimidex causing this so I am thinking if all is fine I will have to stop Arimidex and take a chance of BC coming back . I don't see any other choice. Has anyone else had high cholesterol or liver problems?
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: Thanks for the info. I hate mine when I sleep on left side sometimes it is uncomfortable so looking forward to getting it out. Why do you feel you should have kept it?
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: On Mar 22, 2012 10:02 PM Marep wrote: just because i hated it so much.  i had mine on my right side and the seat belt always made it hurt.  it was so uncomfortable that walking on a treadmill was not an option.  i just felt so limited.  i would like to have it to remind me that it was no longer necessary...like a symbol of post-chemo.  my surgeon asked me if i wanted to keep it...always regretted saying, 'no'.  LOL oh ok I understand...lol
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: On Mar 22, 2012 10:32 PM susier wrote: I hated it as well but my doctor didn't ask me if I wanted to keep it.  The irratatiion now that it is out is as bad as it was while it is in there.  As for the seatbelt that is the worst. Mine is on the left side so as I drive it just hurts so bad that I have to put my arm over it so that just the waist part is on correctly.  As for the lidocaine isn't that like the stuff they give you to put on your port site before you get the chemo.  I think I still have some. Well for all our sakes I hope we never have to see the site of a port ever again. mine is on the left side also so the seatbelt goes right over it. I still use the port pillow when it is hurting I guess I will be using it even when it's out for awhile . You should get a port pillow it works great if you are crafty it is easy to make or go to your local breast  cancer support and they will give you one.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: Hi  Diagnosed with B/C Dec. 09 went through chemo, bilateral mastectomy & radiation and I am on Arimidex for 5 yrs. I just finished all treatments Oct. 2010. I have not had a period for 7 yrs. and now I am spotting with minor cramps. I am going to call dr. on Monday but wondering if anyone has been through this or any have info. Thanks
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer, Menopause question??

Posts.Content: Hi I was diagnosed Dec. 09 with invasive lobular BC. I had bilateral mastectomy Apr. 21st.  At that time 3 lymph nodes were removed to test and all 3 were positive. I had all lymph nodes removed May 12th  and found out today 6 out of 13 that were removed was positive. I have to finish my last 2 chemos then radiation which was told today that radiation will be more than was planned. I am confused with this diagnosis and not sure if this is good news because all 13 were not cancer but then they can't tell me what 6 nodes was positive. Does anyone know about the nodes? I really didn't understand how surgeon explained it. Any info is greatly appreciated. Thanks Diane
Posts.Title: Positive lymph nodes ??

Posts.Content: On Mar 08, 2012 3:30 AM glasshalffull wrote: Yes, they took me off Tamoxifen as it obviously wasn't working. First op was a lumpectomy, but as I had radiotherapy breast had to be taken away on second reoccurance. First diagnosis was in November 2005 and second in November 2010. I'm feeling great though. Just need to keep on taking the tablets. :) thanks for info.  my sister in law just had a recurrance after 16 yrs. of being cancer free had lumpectomy then and now had bilateral.  My best friend going through chemo now with stage 4 went to the bones....I beleive the odds 1 out of 8 women is a lot higher than that I beleive it is 1 out of 4 women...stay strong ....
Posts.Title: Arimidex versus Tamoxifen??

Posts.Content: On Mar 07, 2011 12:21 AM noknots wrote: I just passed my 5 years on it on 2/20/10 and I had about all the side effects, it gives you hot flashes and night sweats, raises cholesterol and tryglicerides, gives you neuropathy, I had cataracts removed but I think that was from the chemo directly.  I am tired for lack of sleep and the pain.  I had allergic reaction to the dosataxel and it was like being beaten by a baseball bat with nails in it.  I seem to live in out patient surgery trying to reduce the pain levels 20+ on there scale of 10.  I had acupuncture thru my chemo and have since.  It helps will side effects, I also take some of the chinese herbs.  My acpuncturist is qualified chinese herbologist and can do injections and uses a cool laser also.  The pain gets overwhelming but most of the time I can refocus away from it.  I learned biofeedback a long time ago.  Also when you get angry, type a letter in a blank page and figure out why your angry and then trash it when you are done.  Really helps take some of it away, I have to do it often, they messed me up for life and I was only stage 1 but you are in shock so you follow their protocal and with a damaged liver and immune system I should have only had the radiation.  I've read enough to know that. If you have any questions you can email me, I just signed into this site so I don't know if they put emails but I will check box if someone replies.  Good Luck its a 5 year after chemo and radiation are done deal and I don't finish the little buggers until 11/2/11. noknots Hi  I had  stage 3 invasive lobular, bilateral mastectomy, lymph nodes removed, chemo & radiation. Was put on Arimidex 6 months ago I started with side effects which I lived with and could not picture myself living like this for 5 yrs. the pain was so bad I could not get out of bed sometimes but then I thought it may my Fibromyalgia getting worse. Getting so dizzy daily the room spinning diagnosed with Vertigo. I am 7 yrs. post menopause and started spotting and very crampy did read it is a side effect of Arimidex called Oncologists and she told me to stop taking it and make Appt. with Gyn.  I  went for ultrasound today to rule out Uterine Cancer but I am being positive that it is from the Arimidex. I  am thinking of not going back to a 5 yr. pill but I am not really sure what to do. I go B/C support group and one girl is taking Arimidex with no side effects and on it for 8 mths.  but we are all different.   Glad to see you made it the 5yrs with the pain. .... I fell like I need a cane already I can't imagine 5 yrs. and I have a high tolerance pain. Any advice you have? Thanks
Posts.Title: The person just starting Armidex

Posts.Content: I am taking Arimidex after diagnosed with Stage 3 BC  , bilaterol mast. and radiation. I am 56 post menopause. My sister who is 59 post menepause just started Tamoxifen to prevent BC after found mass which was not cancer but could lead to cancer. I thought Arimidex was for post-menopause and tamoxifen was for pre-menopause.  I guess I am wrong but could you post if you are on Arimidex or Tamoxifen and if you are pre- or post and why your doctor chose that medication. I really thought my sister would be taking Arimidex also so I'm confused. she was told Arimidex is for us who have cancer and Tamoxifen is to prevent it. Thanks
Posts.Title: Arimidex versus Tamoxifen??

Posts.Content: On Mar 08, 2012 3:15 AM glasshalffull wrote: I started off with Tamoxifen, but cancer returned and I am now taking Arimidex. I was told that Tamoxifen costs less, which is why I was prescribed it first of all. I have found that I am getting stiffness taking Arimidex, but do regular exercise to try and offset this and it is monitored. As for reconstruction - yes, this was done at the same time as the mascectomy, but waiting to have another op to balance with t'other side. I've had no problems with the reconstruction and post op period was managed very well with only a stiff feeling. :) :)  Your cancer returned? How soon did it return?  so they stopped Tamoxifen because the cancer did return?
Posts.Title: Arimidex versus Tamoxifen??

Posts.Content: On Mar 08, 2012 1:46 AM mandd5girls wrote: I started out with Arimidex after having stage 3 BC, bilateral mast. and chemo.  After 2 months I begged to try something else as the pain in my joints was horrible.  I was then put on Tamox. which my oncologist said was fine although I am post menopause.  I think that both are used on women in both categories.  Hope that helps. Thanks for the info I was confused because we were told different things...  I also had chemo forgot to post that ...oops..I am dealing with the bone pain now Oct. will be 2 yrs. on Arimidex so I may have to change meds....did you have reconstruction? ...I have not yet had it but not sure if I want too I have heard so many people who had problems..
Posts.Title: Arimidex versus Tamoxifen??

Posts.Content: I also diagnosed with lobular invasive Dec. 2009  and had double mastectomy , lymph node removal 16 nodes were cancer, chemo & radiation and now on Arimidex for 5 yrs. after 6mths of Arimidex had quite a few side effects, bone & joint pain was so bad and did start spotting after being postmenopausal for 7 yrs. Stopped taking Arimidex went for hysteroscopy to rule out cancer , all fine and oncologists told me to restart Arimidex I asked her what if I didn't go back on it? She said that this pill is even more important than the chemo I was on. That did make up my mind to go back on and praying I do not get the side effects I had before. Was told should wait 1 yr. from radiation to have reconstruction Dr. said a lot of women do not wait the yr. and have a lot of complications. I decided to wait the yr. or even more. hope I was able to help
Posts.Title: what are the benefits of hormonal therapy after double mastectomy

Posts.Content: On Feb 24, 2010 5:48 PM Rivergal wrote: On Feb 23, 2010 11:32 PM jpah123 wrote: Hi, I am awaiting my results form a breast biopsy but was told I probable have stage iv breast cancer that has gone to my bones. I currently have a lower back fravture which brought along other tests to see why this happened. My mamagram came out ok but my CAT scan showed suspicion in my breast along with 6-8 places in my spine, ribs, pelvic, etc. I have been reading a lot I want to start on treatment. I have been suffering with my broken bone in my back for 5 months and feel a lot of pain in the places the CAT scan showed disease. Should I start taking Immunopower, Ultramet, Polymvul or is there soething better. I think the doctors will give me a gloomy outlook but I want to start fighting back right now. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated. Hi, Have you been given your diagnosis yet?  Your case sounds very similar to mine, depending on what type of cancer you actually have.  You can click on my profile to read about mine, but the bottom line for me is that having Stage IV LOBULAR breast cancer (which was determined by a biopsy to a couple of my vertibrae) is not such a bad thing, so don't panic.  I was diagnosed in July & thought I wouldn't have much time so I gave away a lot of things that I wish I had kept since I really feel just like I did before I knew I had cancer.... some aches & pains, but mostly just fine.  I have no symptoms at all & have been told I can "live for years" with this disease & that seems to be the way Stage IV lobular breast cancer works because I've heard from others who are the same. If your diagnosis is the same, I can go into more detail as far as treatment goes.  I'll be hoping for the best for you.  Write me....... Toni sorry to hear of your diagnosis. I was diagnosed with Invasive Lobular Breast Cancer but was told it can not be staged until after surgery. I am so confused about this.  Dr. did say because of the size it is stage II but won't know till later. I am doing 6 tretments of chemo then told full mastectomy, then radiation then 5 yrs. on some kind of pill.  Mine is not mestastasized. Any info on staging would be greatly appreciated. Thanks Diane
Posts.Title: diagnoised with stage iv breast cancer metastasized to bones in spine and pelvic

Posts.Content: I also diagnosed with lobular invasive Dec. 2009  and had double mastectomy , lymph node removal 16 nodes were cancer, chemo & radiation and now on Arimidex for 5 yrs. after 6mths of Arimidex had quite a few side effects, bone & joint pain was so bad and did start spotting after being postmenopausal for 7 yrs. Stopped taking Arimidex went for hysteroscopy to rule out cancer , all fine and oncologists told me to restart Arimidex I asked her what if I didn't go back on it? She said that this pill is even more important than the chemo I was on. That did make up my mind to go back on and praying I do not get the side effects I had before. Was told should wait 1 yr. from radiation to have reconstruction Dr. said a lot of women do not wait the yr. and have a lot of complications. I decided to wait the yr. or even more. hope I was able to help
Posts.Title: what are the benefits of hormonal therapy after double mastectomy

Posts.Content: On Jan 28, 2010 5:47 PM Rivergal wrote: Hi, I am so happy to hear that you are doing well 3 years after being diagnosed! Especially if it had spread to your stomach... I thought that would be a very bad thing, but apparently you managed to beat it! Congrats on that!  We live in a small town with no breast cancer support groups so I've been frustrated by having no one to compare notes with.... Can I make you my 'friend' so we can do that? I appreciate the info!  Keep up the good 'work"!  I too have some extra padding around the middle, not sure I can blame it on the meds, may be more likely too much 'comfort food'. I asked my doc if I should still go on a diet, as I had planned, or if it was like on the TV show "Survivor" where the chubby ones last longer, LOL  He said I did not need to go on a diet.  I would like to do some weight training as I used to but not sure that's ok with cancer in my back bones.  I am also having all my original tests repeated now, & so far, so good.  Dexascan on my back was 'normal'  (weird, as you said), CT of my head is 'normal', just had another nuclear bone scan yesterday, no results yet.  Thanks for writing & please keep in touch!  Toni I was diagnosed with Invasive Lobular Breast Cancer stage II in Dec. 09 . My treatment is 6 treatments of chemo which I am starting my 3rd on Monday. Then masectomy then radiation then 5 yrs. on some kind of pill I forgot the name.  My tumor has gotten smaller just after 2 treatments so I know the chemo is working. I am thinking I may not need mastectomy if it is smaller maybe I will need a lumpectomy It's all so confusing. How come you aren't getting chemo with stage 4? My prayers are with you all Diane
Posts.Title: Lobular breast cancer?

Posts.Content: Hi I am still mourning the loss of my husband that had stomach cancer and passed 2 mths. ago. Now I just had a biopsy and have breast cancer. I have to make a decision if I want to do chemo or have a mastectomy. Has anyone had a mastectomy and have any info on how the surgery was. I don't want to do chemo after seeing my husband suffer for 8 mths. I am seriously thinking to do the mastectomy. I do have an appt. to see breast reconstrutive dr. next week. thanks for any info
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed today
